item.title: Donald Glover’s stroke was caused by this common (but treatable) defect
item.description: Readers respond to Post articles and commentary.

item.title: The European Union’s hypocrisies on Ukraine
item.description: France, Germany and Belgium see the speck in Trump’s eye but don’t notice the log in their own.

item.title: Hegseth’s ‘who cares?’ doctrine is finally taking heat
item.description: In U.S. history, war crimes have been rare. Accountability is needed to keep them that way.

item.title: Let’s not idolize AI. That’s an age-old mistake.
item.description: In every generation, some advanced piece of machinery comes to seem like a model of the human mind.

item.title: The last act of the feature film
item.description: Netflix’s purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery could mean curtains for going to the movies.

item.title: ‘Relax’ is not a winning economic message
item.description: Consumers estimate they’ll spend an average of $778 on holiday presents, down from $1,012 last year.

item.title: There’s no middle ground on the boat strikes
item.description: The second strike matters less than the warped policy that justified the operation at all.

item.title: Grab some popcorn for the political battle over this movie mega merger
item.description: Warner Bros. is the cursed monkey’s paw of the entertainment industry.
